string.name: title_schedule
string.translation_description: The title for the schedule screen where user can see their schedule for the Android Dev Summit.

string.translation_description: The title for the info screen where user can see various information, such as FAQ and travel info.

string.name: title_agenda
string.translation_description: The title for the agenda screen where user can see all the sessions they plan to attend.

string.name: filters

string.name: reservation_error

resources.string: Error making changes to reservation. Wait for previous requests to finish or try again later.

string.name: reservation_request_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user tries to reserve a seat for a session.

string.name: reservation_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation for a session.

string.name: reservation_new

string.translation_description: The message shown when user has chosen to replace a reservation for another and it is confirmed by the system.

string.translation_description: The message shown when user is added to the waitlist of a session reservation.

string.name: waitlist_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation and was waitlisted for a session.

string.name: dont_show
string.translation_description: The label for opting out of in-app notification messages.

string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because the session starts too soon

string.name: reservation_denied_clash
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because they have reserved another event at that time

string.name: reservation_denied_unknown
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because of an unknown error

string.name: cancellation_denied_cutoff
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is trying to cancel a reservation but it's denied because the session starts too soon

string.name: cancellation_denied_unknown

string.name: attending_sessions_description
string.translation_description: Attending sessions instructions

resources.string: All presentations will be in English. Attendance at sessions and product demos is on a first-come, first-served basis.

string.name: badges_description
string.translation_description: Badges instructions

resources.string:
The two-day event kicks off on Wednesday, 23 October with badge pick-up and breakfast starting at 8:00 AM and the keynote address at 10:00 AM. We recommend arriving at the Google Event Center (MP7) in time to register, enjoy the complimentary breakfast, and get comfortable before the keynote starts at 10:00 AM.

Make sure to bring your photo ID along with your registration confirmation email, as we’ll need to verify it prior to assigning your badge for this event. We’re OK with government-issued licenses, passports, and other forms of identification. If you don’t have proper identification, then you won’t receive a badge and you will not be admitted into the conference.

Please note, you may not share, give, or otherwise provide your event badge to anyone. Badges aren’t replaceable, so don’t lose yours or you won’t be readmitted to the conference. You must wear your badge to gain admission to this event, including the sessions, codelabs, and after hours. If requested by security, please display or provide additional identification. Badges may include your name and company or organization (if provided).

Google strives to make events open and accessible to everyone, regardless of disability or special needs. Participants with disabilities and/or special needs should provide details in the registration form and/or by emailing us at android-dev-summit@google.com. This information will be kept private and will be distributed only to the individuals who need to know it to complete accommodation requests. Otherwise, please approach the help desk at the event venue if you need assistance or have questions about accessibility during the event.

Attendees must be at least 15 years old to attend unaccompanied. All attendees under 18 years of age must return a signed parental/guardian consent form in advance of the event. Please contact android-dev-summit@google.com to obtain and submit a consent form prior to attending the event.

The event will be held indoors. It’s a developer event with no enforced dress code, so please be comfortable and casual. There will be a free coat check available near registration for your convenience.
No promotion, soliciting for any cause, lobbying, or selling of items or services is allowed at this event. Any attendee conducting these activities may be removed from the event.

string.name: event_sessions_description
string.translation_description: General information on sessions

resources.string: Sessions are a chance to learn about Android’s newest technologies directly from Android engineers and leadership. Here you’ll see presentations and demos on our latest features and updates from the staff who helped build them.

string.name: event_sandbox_description
string.translation_description: General information on sandboxes.

resources.string: Dedicated spaces to explore, learn, and play with our latest products and platforms via interactive demos, physical installations, and more.

string.name: event_codelabs_description
string.translation_description: General information on codelabs.

resources.string: Google Developers Codelabs provide a guided hands-on coding experience by stepping you through the process of building a small application, or adding a new feature to an existing application.

string.name: event_lightning_description
string.translation_description: General information on Lightning talks.

resources.string: A lightning talk is a very short and focused presentation that lasts only a few minutes, using a format that introduces urgency. This style of micro presentation allows many speakers to present in a single session at a forum, thereby quickly transferring information and avoiding “death by powerpoint” at conferences.

string.name: event_afterhours_description
string.translation_description: General information on after hours.

resources.string: All registered attendees are invited to the party on the evening of October 23. Event credentials will be required for entry. Please join us for food, drinks, music, games, and more. Alcoholic beverages will be available for those 21 years of age and over.

string.name: event_officehours_description
string.translation_description: General information on office hours and app reviews.

resources.string: Office Hour Pods are your chance to meet one-on-one with Android experts to ask all your technical questions! Here, you’ll have an opportunity to receive advice and tips on your specific app-related projects.

string.name: event_fireside_description
string.translation_description: General information on Fireside chats.

resources.string: A fireside chat is an informal discussion between a moderator and one or more Android professionals in front of an audience. Although there won’t be a fire to sit beside, the conversational tone of the chat typically evokes an easy and relaxed language that promotes examples and analogies for better understanding. The audience is often invited to ask questions or make remarks either during or after the chat.

string.name: event_meals_description
string.translation_description: General information on meals.

resources.string: Attendees are offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, and snacks on the days of the conference.
Android Dev Summit 2019 will be held October 23–24, 2019, at the Google Event Center (MP7), 1160 Bordeaux Dr, Sunnyvale, CA 94089.

For the latest information about sessions, speakers, and activities, visit the Android Dev Summit website, follow us on Twitter, or sign up for event updates. You can also follow and join the social conversation about the event via the official #AndroidDevSummit hashtag. In addition, we will email important information to all accepted applicants, along with check-in instructions prior to the event.

If you cannot attend this event in person, then watch the livestream of the keynote and all sessions on the app or on the Android Dev Summit 2019 website throughout the event. Sessions will be recorded and available after the event on the Android Developers YouTube Channel.
This is complimentary for attendees and will be available outside of the venue during event hours. Parking will be on a first-come, first-served basis.

Free parking will be available to attendees. Please park in Parking Structure A (PSA) located at 1150 Bordeaux Drive. If that is at capacity, additional parking is at Parking Structure C (PSC) located at 1200 Bordeaux Drive. Attendees can then walk to the MP7 venue by following the signage and talking to brand ambassadors.
For any lost and found, please report to the help desk near registration where any items handed in will be kept safely.
Attendees are offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, and snacks each day of the event.

There will be a mothers room and a multifaith contemplation room available on site throughout the event. Also, there will be a family lounge where families can sit together to watch the livestream. Please ask the registration staff for information when you check in.
Please review our Community Guidelines to ensure that Android Dev Summit 2019 is a harassment-free and inclusive event experience for everyone.

We do not offer childcare on site. However, we’re excited to offer child-care reimbursement for Android Dev Summit 2019! Children ages 12 years or younger are eligible. Please email us at android-dev-summit@google.com by October 18. Due to limited availability, we might not be able to assist with all requests. To receive reimbursement, a completed W9, final invoice for reimbursement with supporting receipts must be submitted no later than November 22.
